metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1604 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The parser cache functionality in parsergenerator.py in RPLY (aka python-rply) before 0.7.1 allows local users to spoof cache data by pre-creating a temporary rply-*.json file with a predictable name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pypy-rply - 0.7.1-1
python-rply - 0.7.1-1
python3-rply - 0.7.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-rply package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.1-1').
